Climb the Musegg Wall The Museggmauer is a preserved section of Lucerne’s old city walls, complete with medieval watchtowers. In summer, some of the towers are open to visitors and offer panoramic views over the city and lake. 6. Stroll through the old town Lucerne’s Altstadt is a maze of cobbled lanes, colourful facades and painted guild houses. You’ll find shops, cafés and fountains tucked around nearly every corner. It’s a great place to wander without a fixed plan. 7. Ride the funicular to Gütsch For a quieter viewpoint, take the short funicular up to the Château Gütsch area. The view over the city and lake is fantastic, and it’s a peaceful spot away from the crowds. 8. Visit Richard Wagner's villa The composer lived here from 1866 to 1872.
